"This course is one of four in a program designed to help you understand the basics of Moodle administration. You will learn about managing a Moodle site from the Administration interface within Moodle.""
"We shall assume that you have a MoodleCloud site or other Moodle site with an admin account. (You can also explore "MoodleBox
<li>"for new Moodle users who want to quickly learn how to manage a Moodle site but don't have server or coding skills.</li">""
<li>"for educators who have a MoodleCloud site which they plan to manage themselves and use for teaching classes.</li">""
<li>"for anyone with an interest in learning a little about how a Moodle site works.</li">""
<li>"for Moodle users wanting help with installation

column1: <li>" A course in Moodle is a space where teachers add learning materials for their students.</li">""
<li>"Courses can be organised into course categories and subcategories
column2: which you can hide if you wish. Courses can only be in one category.</li">"<li"

column1: <li>"You can specify course default settings from Site administration > Courses > Course default settings. Teachers can change these settings in their courses.</li">""
<li>"You can also enable Course requests. This displays a button so users can request an empty course be made for them.</li">""
"The video below explains how to manage courses. The transcript and mp4 video may be downloaded from the section: "Videos and transcripts for download.
<li>"An administrator can add a new course from Site administration  >  Courses  >  Add a new course.">""
<li>"The list of courses is also shown on the courses page yoursite.com/<i">"<b"

column2: they can edit the course settings.</li">""

7fd49cd79858a0558dc7cc687965bea6,"This tutorial is for administrators to help you manage courses on your Moodle site. It's not to help you teach with Moodle. For more information about teaching with Moodle, explore our <a href=""https://moodle.academy/mod/page/view.php?id=57&forceview=1"">"Educator pathway. </a">"<br"
<li>"The Course navigation gives editing teachers access to Settings (for example
column2: changing the course name)
column3: Participants (where they can edit enrolment methods if allowed) and Grades. </li">""

column1: <li>"The More link gives access to other functions such as the course Question bank (for the Quiz) and Content bank (for H5P activities.)</li">""

<li>"Learning resources are added by enabling Edit mode top right  and then clicking Add an activity or resource at the bottom of one of the course sections. This opens up the <a href=""""/mod/book/view.php?id=629&chapterid=906""""">"Activity chooser.</a"
<li>"An 'activity' is something a learner interacts with
column2: like an Assignment or Quiz.</li">""

column1: <li>"A 'resource' is static content that is read
column2: watched or listened to
column3: like a video file or a PDF.</li">""

"We would appreciate if you would answer these short questions. It should take only a few minutes to complete.
f1ebcb42037f6ad3958f3e26539afedc,"This course launched in April 2022 and is now based on <a href=""https://docs.moodle.org/404/en/Main_page"">"Moodle 4.4</a">" functionality.""

f615237738eee2073d1a002e22ddd97f,"

"You have created a new course but the course is not showing for students in their My courses tab in the 'In progress' dropdown. What might be the reasons? You can select more than one."

column2: you set the course visibility to 'hide'</p">"

column1:
bdd554ff09f30bb921d6aac718057412,"

"Correct. That is one reason. You hid it while you were preparing it."

61513d5ad33887130b8e819c17c6a4cb,"

"In the course settings you have set the start date to a time in the future"

c37fabfd292c6511541112b77a23a354,"

"Yes. The course will probably be in their 'Future' dropdown."

6fc3e9b857e23a14f8ccce3fb5c3a392,"

"You have not yet enrolled the students into the course"

704436a77b1844fc2ec43361f9aa2b95,"

"Correct. It only appears in My courses when they are enrolled."

8584e4e414a628fa0dfa9ac2f4a1c9cf,"

"The course does not have any content in it yet if they are enrolled."

7c028fed7fa79a8eef003b88469cd851,"

"Incorrect. That should not make any difference."

f41c0c998d0f59398f2f0145433288dd,"

"This screenshot shows a student's My courses page with course images for each course.  How did the course images get there?"

e5541ba50ae7c329e7b658a9eafc0b57,"

"They are part of the standard Boost theme"

5b93c91d3902dd302acf5fdf18c94b65,"

"No - these images do not depend on the Boost theme."

ec90aa936931d3da470f5d9d31ecded4,"

"The administrator adds them from Site administration  > Courses  > Course default settings."
a682aec06ea13a3e0edc970ce66739e6,"They are added from the course settings within each course.","","id","5913">"">""

9a05f8300b1879ddde83302846d62935,"

"Yes. Anyone who can edit the course settings such as admins or teachers can add them."

f9e502a3bd01349f2e3c44dd5ec37c8f,"

"They are part of a course template."

628d07e8cd6851f02a800f7b81f99067,"

"No. No template is needed to add the various images."

Which of the following can be downloaded by learners from the website when they click the link? Select all that apply.","","id","5913">"">""

f0860178882fa0d436ed00a235a95725,"

"Elio is the administrator of a new Moodle site. There are fifty teaching staff and they each want a course of their own. What is the most efficient way for him to organise this?"

6d3882aca3f6f56b8db43656561fa2a2,"

"Review the Tutorial: Course set up for more information."

783d78048fcef7f88693b1751ac8ecc6,"

"Enable Course request and ask them to each request a course."

ac366a0ea56fc6cb786434b75aa9a6dd,"

"This would work
column2: but is not the most efficient way
column3: since Elio would still have to manually approve all the courses - and wait for some staff who might be late with their requests.</p">"

column1:
6a5f8ab92f05482a60842552ba9bae4c,"

"Add the details of the courses and teachers to a CSV and upload the file."

0953889c29585c8f370f0879c706f93b,"

"This is the most efficient way."

1b84c0609d30be729098ce36c3e6fb8a,"

"Manually create fifty courses by clicking 'Add a new course'"

696c14cf801f28baeddf106a3b508cff,"

"This would take ages!"

64ce403f501ebe87744650986a5e368f,"

"Employ an intern to create the courses by clicking 'Add a new course'"

50d020e562b4b0376caa42798113dbfe,"

"This is not the most efficient way
column2: even if we assume it is possible for Elio to employ an intern.</p">"

column1:
d461661877b7f45fedea3e36404b2343,"

"Trainer Bob attended a Moodle Academy webinar on MoodleNet
column2: the site for finding
column3: sharing and curating open source educational content. He was told that he can access it in his course from the Activity chooser when he clicks Add and activity or resource
column4: but he doesn't see the link to MoodleNet. What might be the problem?</p">"

column1:
23294d294778f55fdf74ab2282340349,"

"Review the section 'Add content' in the Tutorial: Set up courses for more information."

88f7ab28dfc86cc7e56841e774437f46,"

"MoodleNet integration is disabled in Site administration >Advanced features."

12ae42e2715997d01fe7f6243263da96,"

"Yes. From Moodle 4.0 onwards
column2: it is enabled by default
column3: so he should speak to the administrator about this.</p">"

column1:
7305b85e48bc4184514b1dee629110ca,"

"He is looking in the wrong place. MoodleNet is in the More link from Course navigation."

e1edd5812804287591f1b6bcb4249470,"

"The administrator needs to manually add MoodleNet as an External tool (LTI)"

1f6b9bc5b85c26a27fe9255fff26b19f,"

"MoodleNet is a separate site from his organisation's Moodle site."

column2: but not relevant.</p">"

column1:
f9a5212c6cad733eedbd5031445b57ce,"

"A friend has given you a copy ('backup') of a Moodle course they designed on their Moodle site. You need to add it to your Moodle site. Where would you go to add this course?"

58b70a871cd0e89a4226711f854f3191,"

"It is not necessary to use the 'Add a new course' option simply to upload the course your friend made."

6840429b2f22a02ff52311ec521ceb75,"

"This is correct. The process of uploading an existing course backup is called 'Course restore'."

d96459df931ddd0ad4bd202a10b0d6c1,"

"No. The term 'import' is used in Moodle for bringing in materials from courses already on your site
column2: not courses from other sites.</p">"

column1:

e52c55ba29db72c032f63e8f77b5d9d4,"

56665ea22875cbfaf5bed89c3d6997e9,"

46536e53174f542bd5a0fa8f744aad2e,"

948c6858d85c443b7ab206ffe6e2e36b,"

"Teaching staff can remove the tab themselves from the course settings."

a904948472a9f0963fb15651fcb2d55a,"

"Think again! And check the "Activity chooser documentation
dda4e7799f6f35357bff95486349f49d,"You can remove the tab from Site administration > Courses > Activity chooser settings.","","id","5913">"">""

column1:
deda8f00c452fa0ec9822533e82e6708,"

"Your colleague is confused by the term 'Restore'. When do you use it?"

1d4d96f640add680874ecca1fd9a3820,"

"Review the sections 1 - 5 in the Tutorial: Course creation for more information."

95bab53266a6121152629caef54377f2,"

"It helps you fix a problem with a corrupted course."

e4e398e501f215e5f90c62c99e71c37c,"

"It is Moodle's term for saving and downloading a course to your computer."

bbf2fe17b2143b95d1e9cf13e105f294,"

"That is another term - make sure you know it!"

5c35faaf21245b17622f741f285cc1b6,"

"It is for uploading an existing course to your Moodle site."

66ef94c68106b7cdd7723144d60beb8e,"

"Yes. Usually it is from a different Moodle site but you can also restore a course from within your site."

f0ed2c01853793f91c46eee26cd2812d,"

"It is for uploading a CSV file with course information."
